intro: Notholaena chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean spurge, is a perennial herb native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It has a rosette growth form with thick, fleshy stems and leaves that store water. Notholaena chilensis is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun.
